summary: Radioisotope power systems enable NASA to conduct space exploration missions where solar or other power sources are not feasible (such as in deep space). These systems convert heat generated by the natural decay of plutonium 238 (Pu-238), a scarce resource, into electricity. title: Space Exploration: DOE Could Improve Planning and Communication Related to Plutonium-238 and Radioisotope Power Systems Production Challenges
